citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water
citeinfo.title: WATERWELLS_IDNR_IN: Water-Well Locations in Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Point Shapefile)

citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water
citeinfo.title: Indiana Online Water Well Record Database

descript.abstract:
NOTE: The original data set named WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_100217.SHP was provided to Indiana Geological Survey personnel on February 17, 2010, personnel from the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water, Resource Assessment Section.
NOTE: An updated data set named WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_120312.SHP was provided to Indiana Geological Survey personnel on March 15, 2012, by Mr. Michael P. Martin, GIS Coordinator, Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Outdoor Recreation.
NOTE: An updated data set named WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_130530.SHP was provided to Indiana Geological Survey personnel on July 23, 2013, by Mr. Michael P. Martin, GIS Coordinator, Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Outdoor Recreation.
NOTE: An updated data set named WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP was provided to Indiana Geological Survey personnel on June 16, 2016, by Mr. Michael P. Martin, GIS Coordinator, Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Outdoor Recreation.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR for the source shapefile WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP:
"This file is a digital geospatial point feature class of both located water well records (which include UTM coordinates) and unlocated water well records (without UTM coordinates as of 200911). The estimated locations used for the unlocated wells were based on the polygon centroid values for the smallest indicated section, quarter, quarter-quarter, or quarter-quarter-quarter section (as indicated in the database) for over 250,000 water well records and for about 26,000 of the 250,000 water well records the UTM's were obtained from address geocoding using the owners address, a generally more accurate method (see process steps below)."
descript.purpose:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR for the source shapefile WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP:
"The Division of Water Ground Water Database has approximately 400,000 water well records, and of those, approximately 145,000 have been field located and have x, y (UTM) coordinates. The remaining records have no utms and cannot be easily utilized in a GIS format. The purpose of this shapefile was to include those wells with UTM coordinates and to approximate the UTM coordinates for the others based on the most precise Township, Range, Section, quarter sections (TRS) locations available from office locating, which is effectively the centroid of the smallest known section or quarter sections; thus, increasing the amount of data available for display and analysis in a GIS format. This shapefile is combination of the located water well records and the water well records for which an estimated location was able to be determined using the methods described below. This leaves less than 15,000 records with no UTM's associated with them. This shapefile and associated table has selected fields from the main digital water well database that are typically needed for most research."

cntorgp.cntorg: Indiana Department of Natural Resources/Division of Outdoor Recreation

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS shapefile format, Microsoft Windows XP, approximately 351 MB

attracc.attraccr:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR for the source shapefile WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP:
"Records that did not have locations provided and whose locations could not be estimated using the public land survey system descriptions were removed from this version of the database."

dataqual.logic:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR for the source shapefile WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP:
"Checks for duplicates (unique values in unique records) were performed on this data set. No checks on topology were performed on this data set."
dataqual.complete: This dataset it assumed to be complete, as-is, provided to the IGS from IDNR personnel.

horizpa.horizpar:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDNR for the source shapefile WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP:
"Locations based only on the street address, driving directions, or other location information provided on the well record are considered unlocated records and have no x, y coordinates, only township, range, section, and quarter-quarter-quarter sections (if estimated).
"The x, y coordinates are from the calculated centroid of the smallest possible individual polygon that matched the water well location data. Some records have no quarter sections and/or some of the polygons could not be subdivided, so the centroid of the section was used for those water well records. These are the least accurate coordinates and in a regular one-mile square section the x, y coordinates will generally be within a half-mile of the office located section, on irregular sections, the distance may be greater. The best location values are on the records with quarter-quarter-quarter sections and typically will be within 150 meters of the office located quarters.
"A small number of the data points were checked for accuracy and methods used should keep the x, y coordinates within the proper section in most cases. However, due to the complexity and in cases redundancy in the public land survey system for Indiana some x, y pairs may not be located in the proper section or even the proper county. Other sources of error may be caused by misinterpretation of the driving directions or office locating. Several areas have different survey systems than the Congressional TRS (Clark Military Grant, Military Donations, Meridian Road Lines, Indian Treaties etc.) and no attempt at this time was made to provide centroids for these areas.
"Located records were primarily field located based on the location identified on the USGS 1:24,000 7.5 minute series topo map by the field locator. In some cases the structure or subdivsion may not be on the map and location is based on topography. So some error may be inherent in the field locations and points placed on the map ( a single point on a map may be 100 feet across). The scale is based USGS 1:24,000 7.5 minute series topographic maps. However, in most cases locations of mislocated wells can have large errors, with the reported locations having no meaning."

vertacc.vertaccr: Vertical accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of the data set. No quantitative tests were performed.

citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water
citeinfo.title: WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP well locations from IDNR water-well-log database

srcinfo.srccontr: Well locations from IDNR water-well-log database

procstep.procdesc: Polygon shapefiles representing divisions in the Indiana PLSS were processed to remove non-alphanumeric characters from fields in the attribute tables describing the PLSS subsection location of the water well log (quarter-, quarter-quarter-, or quarter-quarter-quarter-section).

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Geological Survey, Indiana University Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

procstep.procdesc: Polygon shapefiles representing divisions in the Indiana PLSS were spatially joined to LANDSURVEY_COUNTY_POLY_IN.shp using a one-to-many relationship, so sections and subsections on county boundaries could be identified. A new field was added to poly_q.shp, poly_qq.shp, poly_qqq.shp, and Landsurvey_Sections_Poly_IN.shp called "CONCAT," which concatenated the following fields of the attribute tables: TWP,TWPD,RNG,RNGD,PARCEL_ID,QTR,COUNTY. Each layer was then converted to points (polygon centroid locations). A check for duplicates in the CONCAT field was conducted to verify the uniqueness of this field for matching against the water well log database. Several errors were found in LANDSURVEY_COUNTY_POLY_IN.shp and were corrected before proceeding. Using the Calculate Geometry tool in ArcGIS, UTMX and UTMY values were calculated for each point in each section and subsection data layer.
procstep.srcused: poly_q.shp, poly_qq.shp, poly_qqq.shp, Landsurvey_Sections_Poly_IN.shp, and LANDSURVEY_COUNTY_POLY_IN.shp

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Geological Survey, Indiana University Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

procstep.procdesc: The DNR.DBF table obtained from IDNR was imported into a Microsoft Access database called IDNR_waterwells.mdb for processing. A query was conducted to identify records with IDNR locations (UTM coordinates) and those without. A subset of the original fields were retained, including: REFNO, COMPDATE, OWNER, COUNTY, TWN, RNG, QUAR1, QUAR2, QUAR3, SEC, DEPTH, STATIC, PUMPRATE, BAILERRT, WELLUSE, UTMX, UTMY. DBF attribute tables of the section and subsection point files were imported to the Access database from the input shapefiles. A field called CONCAT was added to the unlocated well-log table to concatenate the fields: TWN, RNG, QUAR1, QUAR2, QUAR3, SEC, COUNTY. Relationships were defined in Access using the CONCAT field for the unlocated records and the section and subsection point locations. Queries were conducted for each subsection to assign UTM (NAD 27) coordinates to each unlocated well record based on the best available PLSS location. A field was added to each output query table called "LOC_SRC" and populated with the value "PLSS AND COUNTY MATCH" for each record matched with an estimated coordinate. A field was added to the query table for the located records called "LOC_SRC" and populated with the value "IDNR-WATER" to denote that the locations were sourced from IDNR.
procstep.srcprod: IDNR_waterwells.mdb, LOCATED.DBF, UNLOC.DBF, qmatch.dbf, qqmatch.dbf, qqqmatch.dbf, secmatch.dbf

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Geological Survey, Indiana University Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

procstep.procdesc: A table called ilith.dbf was imported into the Access database (IDNR_waterwells.mdb), and a query was performed to identify records in the original IDNR database with locations corrected during the compilation of the iLITH database. Eight hundred and eighty (880) UTM coordinates in the LOCATED table were replaced with iLITH locations and the LOC_SRC field for these records was populated with the value "ILITH." All water-well records with estimated coordinates were appended into a single table called "matched." This table was then appended to the LOCATED table to produce a single table with located and unlocated well records. In ArcGIS, the Add XY data utility was used to import the water-well locations (located and estimated). The data were exported to a shapefile with an assigned projection of UTM NAD27 Zone 16, which is the native projection of all the IDNR and original iLITH locations. The shapefile was then reprojected to UTM NAD83 Zone 16, and two new fields were added to the shapefile attribute table: UTMX83 and UTMY83. The Calculate Geometry utility was used to calculate the new UTMX and UTMY coordinates for the new UTM 1983 datum. The UTM NAD27 coordinate fields were deleted from the shapefile. The shapefile was clipped to the state boundary to retain only records contained within the boundary. The resulting shapefile was named Waterwells_IDNR_IN.shp
procstep.srcused: IDNR_waterwells.mdb, qmatch.dbf, qqmatch.dbf, qqqmatch.dbf, secmatch.dbf, ilith.dbf

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Geological Survey, Indiana University Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

procstep.procdesc: The attribute table for Waterwells_IDNR_IN.shp was modified to include an attribute called LOCATION to identify records with known versus estimated locations.

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Geological Survey, Indiana University Center for Geospatial Data Analysis

procstep.procdesc: IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from IDNR named "WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_100217.SHP" on April 21, 2010. IGS personnel then saved the file as "WATERWELLS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from IDNR named "WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_120312.SHP" on March 15, 2012. IGS personnel then saved the file as "WATERWELLS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from IDNR named "WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_130530.SHP" on July 23, 2013. IGS personnel then saved the file as "WATERWELLS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from IDNR named "WATERWELLS_DNR_WATER_IN_160616.SHP" on June 16, 2016. IGS personnel then saved the file as "WATERWELLS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

attr.attrdef: Well Reference Number - A sequential unique identification number assigned to each water-well record, some numbers may missing
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Aquifer Elevation in feet (mean sea level[ msl]), usually calculated by subtracting the bottom elevation of the lowest sand and gravel aquifer from the ground elevation (The value 0 or null likely represents no value in the field and values less than 350 or greater than 1257 are likely data-entry errors)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Rate of water production, in gallons per minute, observed during a bailer test at the time of well installation (significance of negative values are not known, likely data-entry errors; values of 0 sometimes indicate dry holes and sometimes denote unreported values). Bailer tests are often conducted on wells with poor water production
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Depth to bedrock in feet ( The values 0 or null likely represents no value in the field and values less than 0 and greater than 500 are likely data-entry errors)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Rate of water production, in gallons per minute, observed during a pump test at the time of well installation (significance of negative values are not known, likely data-entry errors; values of 0 sometimes indicate dry holes and sometimes denote unreported values)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Bedrock elevation in feet(msl), elevation from USGS topographic map, no attempt was made to update this field. Values of 0 or null likely represent no value in this field
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Screen Length (feet) in water well as reported by the driller (null or 0 values screen length was not reported or data-entry omissions, negative values are most likely data-entry errors and values greater than 50 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Static water level in well, in feet below ground surface (negative values denote water levels above ground surface under artesian pressure; 0 or null values represent sometime represent unreported statics or data-entry errors and typically values over 500 feet are considered data-entry errors)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Well depth in feet (0 or null values represent unreported well depths; values below 10 feet and values over 500 feet are likely data-entry errors or oil and gas wells)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Name of Owner listed on water well record, provided by the driller or in some cases updated by the field locator
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Owner address listed on water well record
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Congressional Range, direction
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water (from the Public Land Survey System)

attr.attrdef: Congressional Township, direction
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water (from the Public Land Survey System)

attr.attrdef: Section number determined from USGS Topographic map
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water ( from the Public Land Survey System {Normal Range is 1 to 36, numbers above 36 may sometimes be assigned to INTRESERVENO [Irregular Survey Reserve Number]})

attr.attrdef: Y UTM (north-south) in NAD 27, Zone 16
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: X UTM (east-west) in NAD 27, Zone 16
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Irregular Survey Reserve Number - Public Land Survey System (0 or null values represent no vales reported)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Irregular Survey Reserve Name - Public Land Survey System
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: County name, provided by driller
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Name of the USGS Topographical Map where the well is determined to be located
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Drawdown in feet after bail test (null and 0 values most likely indicate no data, negative values are most likely data-entry errors and values greater than 300 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Reported hours the well was bail tested (0, null and negative values are most likely data-entry errors and values greater than 250 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Diameter of casing (inches) in water well as reported by the driller (0, null and negative values are most likely data-entry errors and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Length of casing (feet) in water well as reported by the driller (0, null and negative values are most likely data-entry errors and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Casing material
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Depth to bottom of grout, from the ground surface in feet (0, null and negative values are most likely data-entry errors or no data, and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Grout method
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Diameter of liner (inches) in water well as reported by the driller (zero or null values are most likely data-entry errors or no data, and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Length of liner (feet) in water well as reported by the driller (zero or null values are most likely data-entry errors or no data, and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Depth of pump setting (feet) in the water well as reported by the driller (zero or null values are most likely data-entry errors or no data, and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Drawdown in feet after pump test (0, null and negative values are most likely data-entry errors or no data and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Reported hours the well was pump tested (0, null and negative values are most likely data-entry errors or no data and values greater than 500 are likely also data-entry errors)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Diameter (inches) of screen in water well as reported by the driller (0, null and negative values are most likely data-entry errors or no data and values greater than 500 may possibly be data-entry errors)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Date water well was completed (Dates with 1/1/XXXX are likely no data or data-entry error and dates later than 10/24/2009 may possibly be data-entry errors)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Ground elevation from USGS topographic map in feet (msl), no attempt was made to update this field. (Values of 0 or null may represent no value in this field or data-entry error)
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Type of well pump
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Telephone number for owner of well
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: X UTM
attr.attrdefs: water well located database is in NAD 83, Zone 16

attr.attrdef: Y UTM
LOC_TYPE is the general method for determining the UTM coordinates.

edom.edomvd: This is based primarily on field location of the well and placing the location on a USGS Topographical map and getting the UTM's form the map, or GPS, also diller provided.
edom.edomvds: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

edom.edomvd: UTM's are based on the Street Address (for details see process steps)
edom.edomvds: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

edom.edomvd: UTM's are based on the Township, RAnge, Section and County as determined by office staff, based on the drillers driving directions, owners address, driller maps, etc. (for details see process steps)
edom.edomvds: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

attr.attrdef: Web URL for the report on file for each water well record
attr.attrdefs: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

overview.eaover: The attribute data is also a subset of he main IDNR-Division of Water, water-well database. It contains only the attributes that would most likely be needed for various groundwater research or site selection for water wells. The complete database is available on at : http://www.in.gov/dnr/water/3595.htm. This site has the full set of attributed located/unlocated and access information.

cntorgp.cntorg: [PRIMARY DISTRIBUTOR] Indiana Department of Natural Resources/Division of Outdoor Recreation

WARRANTY: Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove Avenue, Bloomington, Indiana 47405 2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.

The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
